news.title: Over 660 construction sites yet to install air quality monitors, BMC tells Bombay HC
news.para: The BMC informed the Bombay High Court that 662 out of 1,954 construction sites lack sensor-based air quality monitors. The civic body issued hundreds of showcause and stop-work notices for non-compliance with pollution mitigation guidelines. Despite these issues, the BMC claims Mumbai's AQI remained in the moderate range between December 29 and January 15.

news.title: Noida authority rejected Wiztown Planners' revised layout citing violations of Sports City scheme
news.para: Noida Authority rejected Wiztown Planners' revised layout for a Sector 150 plot, citing violations of the Sports City scheme and a commercial complex appearance. The plan proposed significantly more commercial space than permitted, deviating from the sports-led development mandate. This rejection occurred amidst broader scrutiny of Sports City projects, including CAG objections and Supreme Court directives.

news.title: Cash deals spark I-T searches on 30 premises of two builder groups in Ahmedabad
news.para: The Income Tax department conducted searches on over 30 premises linked to two Ahmedabad builder groups after decoys confirmed cash payments for real estate. The operation, involving over 100 officials, targeted corporate offices, sites, and residences, uncovering transactions worth crores. Documents, digital data, and details of land and projects were seized.

news.title: Noida techie death: Developer arrested; SIT begins probe, report due in five days
news.para: Noida police have taken a real estate executive into custody following the tragic demise of a software engineer, whose vehicle tragically plunged into a water-filled construction pit. The authorities have activated a Special Investigation Team to look deeper into the matter.

news.title: Embassy Developments to invest ₹4,500 crore to enter Mumbai residential market with three projects
news.para: Embassy Developments is investing ₹4,500 crore in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region. Three new residential projects are planned in Worli, Juhu, and Alibaug. These developments will have a combined gross development value exceeding ₹12,000 crore.

news.title: Arkade Developers to invest ₹2,500 crore to develop five residential projects in Mumbai in 2026
news.para: Arkade Developers is set to invest ₹2,500 crore in five new residential projects across the Mumbai Metropolitan Region. These developments are planned for Goregaon, Thane, Borivali, Malad, and Santacruz, commencing in 2026. The combined gross development value is projected to exceed ₹3,700 crore.

news.title: EAAA India Alternatives files ₹1,500-crore IPO papers with Sebi
news.para: EAAA India Alternatives, under the umbrella of Edelweiss Financial Services, is set to launch a Rs 1,500 crore Initial Public Offering. This offering is structured as an offer-for-sale, where existing investors will liquidate their shares.

news.title: SC sets aside HC order directing CBI probe into Ambience Mall project in Gurugram
news.para: The Supreme Court has nullified a High Court ruling that mandated a CBI probe into the land conversion for Ambience Mall in Gurugram. The apex court critiqued the High Court's reliance on unverified claims and acknowledged delays from the petitioners in filing their motions. It upheld the legality of the land de-licensing process.

news.title: Realty investment surges 53% to ₹69,000 crore in Uttar Pradesh: RERA chairman
news.para: Uttar Pradesh's real estate sector is experiencing a significant boom. Investments have reached Rs 69,000 crore in 2025, a 53 percent increase. RERA applications and project approvals are also on the rise.

news.title: RMZ to invest up to $10 billion in Andhra Pradesh over next 5-6 years
news.para: RMZ and the Andhra Pradesh government have inked a USD 10 billion deal. This partnership will boost mixed-use, digital, and industrial infrastructure across the state. Key projects include a GCC at Visakhapatnam's IT Park and a gigawatt hyperscale data centre cluster.

news.title: Lodha   to invest additional ₹1 lakh crore to develop data centre in Maharashtra
news.para: Lodha Developers has announced ₹1 lakh crore investment for a data centre park in Maharashtra. This new commitment follows an earlier ₹30,000 crore MoU signed with the state government.

news.title: New Zealand's Fletcher Building to sell construction arm to French builder
news.para: Fletcher Building of New Zealand has agreed to divest its construction division to the French multinational VINCI SA for NZ$315.6 million. This decision stems from recent earnings pressure attributed to dwindling demand and complications, including a legal dispute related to project delays.

news.title: India Accelerator–IREP partnership to invest ₹100 crore in managed workspaces across NCR
news.para: International Real Estate Partners and India Accelerator are launching a new managed office platform called IREPworkspaces. They plan to invest ₹100 crore over 18 months. The venture aims to create nearly nine lakh square feet of workspace across key areas in the National Capital Region.

news.title: Lucknow: Lottery for Anantnangar scheme on January 30
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority's Anant Nagar housing scheme's plot lottery is scheduled for January 30-31 at Indira Gandhi Pratishthan. The third phase attracted 7,429 applicants for 637 plots across five size categories, with applications invited for plots in Akash Khand and Adarsh Khand.

news.title: Buildings on Idco land owe ₹72 crore to Bhubaneswar civic body in holding tax
news.para: Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation is set to collect Rs 72 crore in holding tax from buildings on Odisha Industrial Infrastructure Development Corporation lands, starting fiscal year 2025-26. Enforcement begins in February, aiming to boost civic body revenue after government approval allowed taxation on these previously exempt properties.

news.title: Gurugram: 83 trees felled to make way for illegal buildings and road in Aravalis
news.para: The forest department has filed a report over violations in the Aravalis following TOI's discovery of a new road and buildings on protected forest land. A fresh inspection revealed 83 trees felled, with further tree felling noted on Thursday, leading to an increased surveillance. This comes amidst ongoing scrutiny of illegal construction in the region.

news.title: Odisha government plans new law to streamline land management
news.para: Odisha is set to introduce the Odisha Govt Land Management Act in the upcoming assembly session, consolidating multiple existing land administration and revenue laws. This new legislation aims to streamline processes, enhance transparency, and improve efficiency in managing government land by replacing archaic statutes with a single, comprehensive framework.

news.title: Now, Mumbai’s Lokhandwala Complex in redevelopment mode, to grow taller
news.para: Lokhandwala Complex, a 40-year-old Mumbai housing colony, is undergoing extensive redevelopment driven by necessity and the desire for larger homes. Original residents, now senior citizens, face rising costs and potential affordability issues with new, larger apartments and increased maintenance expenses.

news.title: Pune civic body earns ₹713 crore from property tax amnesty scheme, extends it
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation has extended its property tax amnesty scheme until February 16, following a successful initial run that collected Rs 713 crore from defaulters. This initiative offers a 75% waiver on penalties, aiming to encourage more property owners to clear dues. The civic body is also finalizing its budget for 2026-27, expected by month's end.
